intro: Bisgoeppertia, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. These plants are characterized by their succulent, often spiny stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. They are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through thick leaves and deep root systems. Bisgoeppertia species typically bloom in the spring or early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to their ornamental value and resilience, they are sometimes cultivated in xeriscapes and rock gardens.
